questions.question: What is the correct form of the verb 'to be'?
Which of the following is a color?
What do you use to write on paper?
Which of the following is a fruit?
What do you use to eat soup?
What is the past tense of 'eat'?
Which of the following is a vegetable?
What is the past tense of 'go'?
What is the past tense of 'eat'?
Which of these is the correct use of 'there'?
What is the comparative form of 'good'?
Which sentence is in the present continuous tense?
What is the superlative form of 'small'?
What is the correct form of 'to have' in the third person singular?
Which sentence uses the past perfect tense?
What is the plural form of 'child'?
Which of these sentences is correct?
What is a 'beach'?
options: a place with sand and sea
questions.answer: a place with sand and sea

questions.question: What is the past tense of 'see'?
Which sentence uses the future continuous tense?
What is the correct form of 'to be' in the present perfect tense?
Which of these sentences is in the passive voice?
options: A book is being read by her.
questions.answer: A book is being read by her.

questions.question: What is the correct form of 'to go' in the past perfect tense?
Which of these is a correct conditional sentence?
options: If I have money, I will buy a car.
If I had money, I buy a car.
If I has money, I would buy a car.
questions.answer: If I have money, I will buy a car.

questions.question: What is the correct form of 'to eat' in the future perfect tense?
What is the correct comparative form of 'interesting'?
Which of these sentences is correct?
Which of these is an example of direct speech?
options: She said that she was tired.

questions.question: What is a 'pharmacy'?
options: a place where medicine is sold
a place where books are sold
a place where food is sold
questions.answer: a place where medicine is sold

questions.question: Which sentence uses the past perfect continuous tense?
options: I had been working all day.
questions.answer: I had been working all day.

questions.question: Which sentence is in the passive voice?
options: The cake was eaten by the children.
The children are eating the cake.
questions.answer: The cake was eaten by the children.

questions.question: What is the correct form of 'to have' in the future perfect tense?
Which of these is a correct second conditional sentence?
options: If I won the lottery, I would buy a house.
If I win the lottery, I buy a house.
If I won the lottery, I buy a house.
questions.answer: If I won the lottery, I would buy a house.

questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses a modal verb?
Which sentence uses the correct comparative form?
options: She is more smarter than him.
She is most smarter than him.

questions.question: What is the correct form of 'to be' in the present perfect continuous tense?
Which of these sentences uses an infinitive?
Which sentence uses the correct form of a phrasal verb?
options: She looked up the word in the dictionary.
She looked the word up in the dictionary.
She looked the word in the dictionary up.
questions.answer: She looked up the word in the dictionary.

questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses a relative clause?
options: The man who lives next door is a doctor.
The man lives next door who is a doctor.
The man which lives next door is a doctor.
questions.answer: The man who lives next door is a doctor.

questions.question: Which word means 'a strong desire to do something'?
What is a 'connoisseur'?
options: an expert judge in matters of taste
questions.answer: an expert judge in matters of taste

questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses a subjunctive form?
Which sentence uses a third conditional structure?
options: If I had known, I would have called you.
If I knew, I would call you.
If I know, I will call you.
questions.answer: If I had known, I would have called you.

questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses a causative verb?
Which sentence is in the correct form of reported speech?
options: She said that she was going to the market.
She says that she was going to the market.
She said that she is going to the market.
questions.answer: She said that she was going to the market.

questions.question: Which sentence uses an appropriate inversion after a negative adverbial?
options: Rarely do we see such talent.
Rarely we do see such talent.
Rarely does we see such talent.
questions.answer: Rarely do we see such talent.

questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses a future perfect continuous tense?
options: By next year, I will have been working here for five years.
By next year, I will have worked here for five years.
By next year, I will be working here for five years.
questions.answer: By next year, I will have been working here for five years.

questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses an adverbial clause of concession?
options: Although it was raining, they went for a walk.
Although it was raining, but they went for a walk.
Although it was raining, yet they went for a walk.
questions.answer: Although it was raining, they went for a walk.

questions.question: Which sentence uses the correct form of a mixed conditional?
options: If I had studied harder, I would be successful now.
If I had studied harder, I will be successful now.
If I studied harder, I would have been successful now.
questions.answer: If I had studied harder, I would be successful now.

questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses a semi-modal verb?
Which sentence uses a correct gerund or infinitive form?
options: I regret telling her the truth.
I regret to tell her the truth.
I regret tell her the truth.
questions.answer: I regret telling her the truth.

questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses a cleft structure?
Which sentence correctly uses an inversion for emphasis?
options: Never have I seen such beauty.
Never I have seen such beauty.
questions.answer: Never have I seen such beauty.

questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses a future perfect passive tense?
options: The work will have been completed by next month.
The work will have been completing by next month.
The work will have been complete by next month.
questions.answer: The work will have been completed by next month.

questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses a perfect participle?
options: Having finished the project, he went to bed.
Having finish the project, he went to bed.
Having finished the project, he goes to bed.
questions.answer: Having finished the project, he went to bed.

questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses a reduced relative clause?
options: The man standing there is my uncle.
The man who standing there is my uncle.
The man who is standing there is my uncle.
questions.answer: The man standing there is my uncle.

questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses a mixed conditional?
options: If I had won the lottery, I would be rich now.
If I had won the lottery, I would have been rich now.
If I win the lottery, I would have been rich now.
questions.answer: If I had won the lottery, I would be rich now.

questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses a passive causative?
Which sentence correctly uses a nominal clause?
Which sentence correctly uses an adverbial clause of time?
options: As soon as he arrived, the meeting started.
As soon he arrived, the meeting started.
As soon as he arrives, the meeting started.
questions.answer: As soon as he arrived, the meeting started.

questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses a gerund after a preposition?
options: She is interested in learning French.
She is interested to learning French.
She is interested for learning French.
questions.answer: She is interested in learning French.
